1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: FUNKEY.C Fri 10-27-2000 9:26:44 pm HvA V2.01 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: function key handling for HVA_WIN
5    | HIST: 19911223 V1.00
6    | 	  20001027 V2.01 - Adapted for DJGPP
7    | ***************************************************************************/
8    | 
9    | /****************************************************************************
10   | *              Function keys handled are:       F1...F10                    *
11   | *                                         SHIFT_F1...SHIFT_F10              *
12   | *                                           ALT_F1...ALT_F10                *
13   | *                                          CTRL_F1...CTRL_F10               *
14   | ****************************************************************************/
15   | 
16   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
17   |                         HEADER FILES
18   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
19   | #include <stdio.h>
20   | #include <stdlib.h>
21   | #include <conio.h>
22   | #include <ctype.h>
23   | #include <dos.h>
24   | #include <string.h>
25   | #include <stdarg.h>
26   | #include "keys.h"
27   | #include "video/v_video.h"
28   | #include "window.h"
29   | 
30   | extern SCREEN _cursvar;
31   | 
32   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
33   |                         PROTOTYPES
34   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
35   | typedef struct
36   | {
37   |   void *function;	/* Function to perform */
38   |   char *text;           /* Text on line        */
39   | }
40   | FUNCTION_HANDLER;
41   | 
42   | // static void init_keylabels(void);
43   | static int func_index(int function_key);
44   | 
45   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
46   |                         CONSTANTS
47   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
48   | 
49   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
50   |                         LOCAL VARIABLES
51   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
52   | static WINDOW *w = NULL;
53   | static FUNCTION_HANDLER funkey[40];
54   | static int show_funkeys = FALSE;
55   | 
56   | /*
57   | #define TESTING
58   | */
59   | 
60   | /*===========================================================================
61   |                         START OF FUNCTIONS
62   | ===========================================================================*/
63   | 
64   | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
65   |     FUNCTION: func_index()
66   |      PURPOSE: Calculate index of a function key
67   |  DESCRIPTION: -
68   |      RETURNS: Calculated index to the array of function handlers
69   |      HISTORY: 911224 V0.1
70   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
71   | static int func_index(int function_key)
72   | {
73   |   int ndx;
74   | 
75   |   switch (function_key)
76   |   {
77   |     case F1:
78   |     case F2:
79   |     case F3:
80   |     case F4:
81   |     case F5:
82   |     case F6:
83   |     case F7:
84   |     case F8:
85   |     case F9:
86   |     case F10:
87   |       ndx = function_key-F1;
88   |       break;
89   | 
90   |     case SHIFT_F1:
91   |     case SHIFT_F2:
92   |     case SHIFT_F3:
93   |     case SHIFT_F4:
94   |     case SHIFT_F5:
95   |     case SHIFT_F6:
96   |     case SHIFT_F7:
97   |     case SHIFT_F8:
98   |     case SHIFT_F9:
99   |     case SHIFT_F10:
100  |       ndx = function_key - SHIFT_F1 + 10;
101  |       break;
102  | 
103  |     case CTRL_F1:
104  |     case CTRL_F2:
105  |     case CTRL_F3:
106  |     case CTRL_F4:
107  |     case CTRL_F5:
108  |     case CTRL_F6:
109  |     case CTRL_F7:
110  |     case CTRL_F8:
111  |     case CTRL_F9:
112  |     case CTRL_F10:
113  |       ndx = function_key - CTRL_F1 + 20;
114  |       break;
115  | 
116  |     case ALT_F1:
117  |     case ALT_F2:
118  |     case ALT_F3:
119  |     case ALT_F4:
120  |     case ALT_F5:
121  |     case ALT_F6:
122  |     case ALT_F7:
123  |     case ALT_F8:
124  |     case ALT_F9:
125  |     case ALT_F10:
126  |       ndx = function_key - ALT_F1 + 30;
127  |       break;
128  | 
129  |     default:
130  |       #ifdef TESTING
131  |         wn_error("Wrong function key %d in init_funct_Fx()",function_key);
132  |       #endif
133  |       return(-1);
134  |   }
135  | 
136  |   return(ndx);
137  | }
138  | 
139  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
140  |     FUNCTION: init_funkey()
141  |      PURPOSE: Initialize a function key
142  |  DESCRIPTION: -
143  |      RETURNS: nothing
144  |      HISTORY: 911224 V0.1
145  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
146  | void init_funkey(int function_key, void *function, char *text)
147  | {
148  |   int ndx;
149  | 
150  |   wn_log("init_funkey(key=%d,function=%p,text=%s\n",
151  |     function_key, function, text);
152  | 
153  |   /*-------------------------------
154  |     Initialize funkey[] variables
155  |   ---------------------------------*/
156  |   ndx = func_index(function_key);       /* Calculate index to array         */
157  |   funkey[ndx].function = function;      /* Copy pointer to funkey function  */
158  |   if (strlen(text) > 6) text[6] = '\0'; /* Check if text is not to long     */
159  |   funkey[ndx].text     = text;          /* Copy pointer to funkey text      */
160  | 
161  | }
162  | 
163  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
164  |     FUNCTION: do_funkey()
165  |      PURPOSE: Perform function, assigned to the function key
166  |       SYNTAX: int do_funkey(int key);
167  |               int key : code of (function) key to perform function on
168  |  DESCRIPTION:
169  |      RETURNS: 0 if function performed (function available)
170  |               function_key if no function performed
171  |      HISTORY: 911224 V0.1
172  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
173  | int do_funkey(int key)
174  | {
175  |   int ndx;
176  | 
177  |   wn_log("do_funkey(key=%2d)\n");
178  | 
179  |   if (is_fkey(key)) {
180  |     ndx = func_index(key);                /* Find array index       */
181  |     if (funkey[ndx].function) {           /* If function defined    */
182  |       (*(PFI)(funkey[ndx].function))();   /* then execute function  */
183  |       return(0);
184  |     }
185  |     else
186  |       return(key);
187  |   }
188  |   else
189  |     return(key);
190  | 
191  | }
192  | 
193  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
194  |     FUNCTION: disp_funkeys()
195  |      PURPOSE: Display function keys on screen
196  |  DESCRIPTION: Display function keys in lower 4 lines of display
197  |               0 = Hide function key display
198  |               1 = normal function keys
199  |               2 = shifted function keys
200  |               3 = CTRL function keys
201  |               4 = ALT function keys
202  |      RETURNS: nothing
203  |      HISTORY: 911224 V0.1
204  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
205  | void disp_funkeys(int i)
206  | {
207  |   int j;
208  |   int row,col;
209  | 
210  |   show_funkeys = TRUE;
211  | 
212  |   if (i<0 || i>4)
213  |   {
214  |     wn_log("wrong index %d in disp_funkeys\n",i);
215  |     i = 1;
216  |   }
217  | 
218  |   /*--------------------------------------
219  |     Check if we have to open a window for
220  |     the function keys, or if this window
221  |     has already been opened.
222  |     The window will occupy the last row on
223  |     the screen with a full length
224  |   ----------------------------------------*/
225  |   if (!w)
226  |   {
227  |     wn_log("*** START FUNKEY\n");
228  |     w = wn_open(_NO_BORDER,_cursvar.lines,0,_cursvar.cols+1,1,_menu_att,_menu_att);
229  |     wn_clear(w);
230  |   }
231  | 
232  |   /*------------------------------------------------
233  |     Check if user wants to hide function key labels
234  |     or to display it
235  |   --------------------------------------------------*/
236  |   if (i==0)
237  |   {
238  |     show_funkeys = FALSE;
239  |     wn_hide(w);
240  |     return;
241  |   }
242  |   else {
243  |     if (show_funkeys == FALSE) {
244  |       show_funkeys = TRUE;
245  |       if (w)
246  |         wn_unhide(w);
247  |     }
248  |   }
249  | 
250  |   /*-------------------------
251  |     Print the function keys
252  |   --------------------------*/
253  |   row = 0;
254  |   col = 0;
255  |   for (j = 0 ; j<10 ; j++)
256  |   {
257  |     wn_locate(w,row,col);
258  |     if (funkey[j].text) {
259  |       wn_printf(w,"%1d%-6.6s",j+1,funkey[j].text);
260  |       wn_setone(w,row,col,_menu_hotkey);
261  |       if (j==9)
262  |        wn_setone(w,row,col+1,_menu_hotkey);
263  |     }
264  |     col+=7;
265  |   }
266  | }
267  | 
268  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
269  |     FUNCTION: exit_funkey()
270  |      PURPOSE: Exit the funkey routine
271  |  DESCRIPTION: Closes the function key window
272  |      RETURNS: nothing
273  |      HISTORY: 920107 V0.1 - Initial version
274  | --#-func--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
275  | void exit_funkey()
276  | {
277  |   if (w)
278  |   {
279  |     wn_log("*** END FUNKEY\n");
280  |     w = wn_close(w);
281  |   }
282  | }
